title: The municipium of the Haluntini honours Gnaeus Pollienus
support: A large square base of the "breccia di San Marco". Mouldings around the top and bottom. Damage to the lower right front corner, the upper right front corner, the upper left corner moulding and ther rear upper left corner. The front face is somewhat eroded, with what appears to be a small patch of grey mortar in the centre. The upper surface has two large footholes, left foot forward, right foot to the rear, each c.8 cm from the front/back edge of the stone and c.25 cm long and 4-9 cm wide. The inscribed front face is 39 cm high x 64 cm wide.

layout.p: The text occupies five lines over the upper part of the front face.

handNote.lettering: Regular letters with a fairly square module, simply engraved without serifs. Alpha has broken bar; Kappa has full length arms; Mu has vertical first and last, with mid-strokes only descending half-way; omicron is full size; Pi has full length verticals, and slightly overlapping horizontal bar; omega is slightly open and nearly circular, with horizontal tails/feet.

date._: The use of the term 'municipium' in Greek places this text almost certainly after the grant of Latin rights to Sicily by Julius Caesar (probably 46 BCE), but equally the use of Greek implies a date not later than the early Augustan period. The lettering is compatible with a late Hellenistic date.

provenanceFound._: First recorded observation is in Gualtherus 1624, where it was seen in the arch of an acqueduct near the Church of S. Antonio. It was observed there still by Salinas in 1880, prior to being removed to the Palermo Museum.

provenanceObserved._: Prag 2024-12-03, on the north side of the second courtyard of the Museo archeologico regionale A. Salinas, Palermo.

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
museum.description: Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.

location.address: Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
